title: Memorializing Governor Andrew M. Cuomo to proclaim January 24, 2011, as Juan Pablo Duarte Day in the State of New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE   RESOLUTION  memorializing  Governor  Andrew  M.  Cuomo  to
proclaim January 24, 2011, as Juan Pablo Duarte Day in the State of  New
York

WHEREAS,  The  people  of  the  Dominican Republic acquired autonomy and
sovereignty on the 27th day of February 1844; and
  WHEREAS, The Island of Quisqueya, the indigenous name for  what  later
become the island of Hispaniola, was the cradle of thinking and advance-
ment  in  the  western hemisphere, establishing the first university and
cathedral of the New World; and
  WHEREAS, On the 26th day of  January  1813,  Juan  Pablo  Duarte,  the
founding father of the Dominican Republic, was born; and
  WHEREAS,  During  the  month of January 2011, Dominicans celebrate the
198th Anniversary of Juan Pablo Duarte's birth; and
  WHEREAS, Juan Pablo Duarte, along with Francisco Del  Rosario  Sanchez
and Ramon Matias Mella, formed La Trinitaria, a secret organization that
initiated  the  movement for the independence of the Dominican Republic;
and
  WHEREAS, During the month of February 2011,  Dominican  Nationals  and
Dominican  Americans  from  throughout  the  Dominican  Republic and the
United States will celebrate the independence of the Dominican Republic;
and
  WHEREAS, Since February 27, 1966, the Instituto Duartiano Inc. in  New
York  City,  has  promoted  the memory and accomplishments of Juan Pablo
Duarte; and
  WHEREAS, The Instituto Duartiano is an organization that is  dedicated
to  maintaining  and  keeping  alive  the life and history of Juan Pablo
Duarte, the liberator and founder of the Dominican Republic; now, there-
fore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
memorialize  Governor  Andrew  M. Cuomo to proclaim January 24, 2011, as
Juan Pablo Duarte Day in the State of New York; in recognition  of  this
auspicious occasion, members of the Instituto Duartiano will visit Alba-
ny, New York, on Monday, January 24, 2011; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  The Honorable Andrew M. Cuomo, Governor of the State of New
York; The Honorable Rafael Evans, Consul General of the Dominican Repub-
lic; and The Honorable Juan R. Elliott, President of the Instituto Duar-
tiano de los Estados Unidos.
